item.title: Lisa add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Forever is composed of nows." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Many people will walk in and out of your life, but only true friends will leave footprints in your heart" -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best. " -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "The purpose of life is to live it, to taste experience to the utmost, to reach out eagerly and without fear for newer and richer experience." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "If someone betrays you once, it’s their fault; if they betray you twice, it’s your fault." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "We all know that Art is not truth. Art is a lie that makes us realize truth at least the truth that is given us to understand. The artist must know the manner whereby to convince others of the truthfulness of his lies." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You have to accept whatever comes, and the only important thing is that you meet it with the best you have to give." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Paul Klee
item.description: "Art does not reproduce the visible; it makes visible." -- Paul Klee

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Learn from the mistakes of others. You can’t live long enough to make them all yourself. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Paul Klee
item.description: "One eye sees, the other feels." -- Paul Klee

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Beautiful young people are accidents of nature, but beautiful old people are works of art. " -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Herman Melville
item.description: "It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation." -- Herman Melville

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "To forbid us anything is to make us have a mind for it." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description:
"Never put off till tomorrow what may be done day after tomorrow just as well".
From: "More Maxims of Mark" -- Mark Twain

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "In the long run, we shape our lives, and we shape ourselves. The process never ends until we die. And the choices we make are ultimately our own responsibility." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "Nothing fixes a thing so intensely in the memory as the wish to forget it." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "We love the things we love for what they are." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Michel de Montaigne
item.description: "The greatest thing in the world is to know how to belong to oneself." -- Michel de Montaigne

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain
